title: Gflags cmake
body: Different Gflags have different namespace.

title: add xworld logo
body: Add xworld logo in readme doc.

title: Some updates on the readme doc
body: Added some updates to the readme documentation.

title: fix opencv imread issue when BUILD_TYPE is inconsistent; update find glog and gflags
body: opencv imread will return empty mat when a mixture of Release and Debug libs are linked. So by default I set XWorld to Release, to be consistent with OpenCV. Also fix FindGflags issue.

title: fixes for compiling
body:
1. libgtest0
2. opencv dependency in CMakeLists.txt
3. remove log file
4. py_simulator help format

title: Add instructions for creating games and test_simple_race
body: More details for creating games. TODO: write C++ test binaries similar to Python test files.

title: optional actions for xworld
body: The agent can choose to take only one of the two actions depending on the task mode. For "arxiv_lang_acquisition", it only needs to return "action"; for "arxiv_interactive", it only needs to return "pred_sentence"; for "one_channel", it has to return both.

title: add instructions to use DeepMind Lab and Malmo
C++ examples
body: C++ examples for simple_race, atari, and xworld.

title: add example for interactive language learning environment
body: Add an example for interactive language learning setting in XWorld2D.

title: fix error of screen type
body: StatePacket will return uint8 for some games, so we need to scale them to [0,1] before outputting in Python.

title: add pytorch implementation of xworld2d
body: Also add two dictionaries used by the papers.

title: fix max step for arxiv_lang_acquisition
body: The arxiv version uses a different max step computation from the current one.

title: add a action success flag
body: robot can now know from the env whether its action takes effect

title: agent_specific_simulator needs to override the last_action_success
body: It was a bug of the last commit. For multi simulator, just assign the success flag is not enough. We need to make the agent specific simulator to override the last_action_success() function, otherwise it will always return true.

title: add Boost Python dependency to libsimulator.so (for C++ use)
body: Before this, we only use Boost Python in py_simulator.so which is not linked by our C++ code.

title: enable task in Python
body: Now the user can define a task given a map in Python. However, the environment is still configured in C++.

title: clean up and add readmes for defining XWorld2D python tasks
Add BinaryBuffer for data serialization; make DataPacket serializable
test_atari should also be optional now
fix the warning of comparing int and size_t
body: i made a mistake and brought my last PR(#26) into this commit again.

title: xworld3d with simple navigation
body: xworld 3d environment based on roboschool

title: more comments and copyright headers
body: Also add flag ego_centric to xworld2d.

title: better handling python errors
body: Sorry that I forgot to wrap try {...} catch {...} around all python calling methods. Currently the way of manual wrapping is kind of tedious. We might want to have a cleaner implementation for this in the future.

title: define tasks and change environment with Python
body: Except for low-level simulator rendering, now all tasks are defined in embedded Python scripts. Also because of this, the teacher can dynamically change the environment at any time step with Python. All the previous C++ tasks are replaced with Python.

title: fix py_gflags
body: Originally, we extend embedded python code by importing a boost python module. This will crash. Now I have bypassed boost python and instead directly use Python.h to extend the code.

title: fix simulator build
body: the change is for our robot repo

title: a version that can compile; for refernece only; DO NOT use this commit.
clean up json confs
body: When simulator_interface wants to get world_dimensions for the teacher, it cannot dynamically cast the game_ to TeachingEnv because it is agentspecificsimulator. So we need to additionally keep a pointer to the teaching environment.

title: improve XWorld3D coordinate and object model system
fix the problem caused by agent 'going into' boundary blocks
add curriculum learning based on agent's performance
body: Now the teacher increases the difficulty level by observing the agent's performance. If the success rate is higher than the predefined threshold, the teacher sets the environment for the next level.

title: add orientation to Entity; sync this info between c++ and python
add python interface and example for xworld3d
body: Just in case that other team members will use this preliminary version of xworld3d

title: xworld3d changes for running single goals
Xworld3d
body:
a working version. Several issues to solve:
1. add orientation into Entity
2. remove the collision shape when removing object
3. jump
4. update entity information in python when changing object positions in c++

title: add teacher architecture explanations
body: More detailed examples are to be added later for XWorld2D and XWorld3D.

title: xworld3d multi-goal
body: fix some bugs for xworld2d and 3d.

title: multi-goal on 7x7 maps with blocks 85%
body: fix the bug of maze generation

title: readme file update
body: Some updates to the README files with some typo fixes.

title: friendly warning messages for python test scripts; add py test for simple_game
Fix x3d flags
body: There are some flags that defined in xword3d and used in the python interface (py_init.cpp). They will cause compilation problems when compiling without xword3d game (e.g. WITH_XWORLD3D=OFF). This PR fixes this issue.

title: fix the extra_info issue for non-xworld games
Fixed compling issues cased by some flags from xworld3d.
body: There are some flags that defined in xword3d and used in the python interface (py_init.cpp). They will cause compilation problems when compiling without xword3d game (e.g. WITH_XWORLD3D=OFF). This PR fixes this issue.

title: Add some more detailed instructions on installing ffmpeg on Ubuntu14.04
body: Add detailed instructions on installing ffmpeg on Ubuntu14.04 with a few other minor updates to the text.

title: 1) turn off testing if users want to; 2) fix multi-process demo
change the reward for NavTargetSide
body: Now whenever the agent hits a goal, the game ends with a wrong_goal_reward

title: modify according to roboschool's remove_qt branch
real egocentric for xworld2d; add navgation tasks for xworld3d; simplify c++ interface examples
body: This is a mixture of three commits. See the title.

title: curriculum is now based on average rate instead of min rate
handle the cases with unspecified color properties and fix a bug
body: Added additional check for handling the cases where the color property is not specified for some goals in properties.txt. Fixed a bug in XWorldDialog.

title: roboschool use opencv to read texture images; clean cmake
body:
1) roboschool uses OpenCV, which is the first step to merge roboschool into xworld3d
2) clean cmake to make folder structures more consistent

title: Improve set_property function in xworld_env.py with a few bug fixes
body:
1) improved the se_property_function function in xworld_env.py to make it more flexible and easy to use
2) fixed a few bugs to make the dialog-based language learning setting work

title: improve xworld3d nav tasks and show smooth screens
fix cmake for roboschool; fix xworld3d pause_screen issue
make_screen should appear after the teaching stage
body: The teacher could change the env at a time step. To avoid a time delay, we should make_screen only after the teaching stage.

title: some version of boost cannot have comments in json
fix opencv in cmake
body: OPENCV_DIR has been discarded for quite a time. Using it to check the existence of OpenCV is not correct.

title: Dialogue-based language learning environment.
body:
In this environment, the teacher verbally interacts with the learner about randomly selected object classes, and provides sentence feedback as well as reward feedback according to learner's response. This provides an environment for grounded language learning through
dialogue interactions.

title: fix a bug that makes the perceived image mis-aligned with sentence.
body: This happens when the teacher changes the environment during teach stage.

title: Allow setting FLAGS_color from python interface
body:
Also the following:
1. fixed overloading of take_actions in py_simulator
2. remove "//" from walls.json because it cannot parsed by some boost version

title: remove xworld3d models each time to avoid old files
fix bugs for xworld2d maze generation and visible radius
better handling of name and asset_path in set_property
add fog regions for xworld2d; enable keyboard control
body: The five navigation tasks are to be migrated from xworld3d to xworld2d

title: Fix a bug in removing unfound entities in xworld3d
body: This bug could lead to incorrect results if there is within session entity deleting.

title: further improve 2d set_property function
body:
*improved the function so that users do not need to delete and add back
entities in order to specify initial locations of entities.

title: Improve the dialog environment
body:
1) add image variation
2) add word level task
3) add sparse reward mode

title: show the current command on top of the video for demo purpose
body: When creating the demo, we should crop the region with the actual width of the image, excluding the right message box.

title: fix entity id related bug in 3d
body: fixed a bug related to setting entity id

title: fixed the window name bug so that there won't be two duplicated windows when update_message_box_on_screen() is called
body:
1) fixed the window name bug so that there won't be two duplicated windows
2) also changed the 3DDialogMap config in accordance to the changed set_property function

title: add a directional arrow for bird view visualization
body: Add a directional arrow representing agent's direction-of-view in the bird-view mode for XWorld3D.

title: 3D-dialog environment
body:
* implementation of 3d env for dialog
* set_property function for 3d

title: add ACL paper to readme
body: Add ACL paper to the readme file and also fixed a broken link for the ICLR paper.

title: release XWorld3D
body: Also updated some README docs.

title: python binding for get_screen_out_dimensions
body: There was a missing Python API for get_screen_out_dimensions

title: A series of changes during my exps for the paper
fix the issue of invalid string memory for xworld3d
refactor the rendering part
body:
It is not fully integrated into XWorld yet. To test xrobot, you need to enter the folder `xrobot` and build the project there using the separate cmake file. 

Changes:
1. add cmake 
2. move rendering related codes to `render_engine`
2. start abstracting rendering related codes from in `world.h`

move camera into render engine; refactor model loading codes
add dry run (running w/o opengl init) function to xworld3d

egl issue

body:
Refactor Code
Add Lidar
Add Tasks
Add Character Movement
Add Different Rendering Support

body: detect EGL before using it

title: Bullet world
body: Some bullet stuffs are still in `world.cpp`

title: finalized the use of floating precisions
body: Bullet has an issue of compiling with `use_double_precision`. We will fix to `double` for now.

title: Refine code
body:
- Separate definitions of `Robot` from `World`; Get rid of `World::robot_list_`
- Refactor files under game_engine
- Pass (const) references as functions' arguments whenever possible

- Update point cloud visualization
- Update maze generation method
- Update readme and examples
